name: Bavarian Manor Country Inn & Restaurant

reviews.title: Absolutely Charming with Excellent Food, Friendliest Staff
reviews.text: The Bavarian Manor Country Inn is one of the most charming places I've ever been to. You instantly feel relaxed upon entering. The rooms are all tastefully and carefully decorated and ever so comfortable. The food is unbelievable, all thoughtfully prepared by the chef/owner. The sauerbraten is the best I've ever had and makes one understand fully why the Culinary Institute has chosen the Bavarian Manor's kitchen as an extern teaching kitchen for Authentic German cuisine. The breakfast is a full breakfast, more to eat than you could ever fit in your stomach and delicious! The staff is warm and friendly and make you feel "at home." They all try and succeed in making you feel as comfortable as possible on your vacation. There's lots to do in the Catskills or it's a great place to stay and just do nothing but relax. There's trails on the property for walking, fishing in the large, very large pond. In the summer, July, the original German Alps Festival is held. It's a fun time with great food. They also do theme weekends, Murder Mystery Dinners, Psychic Fair Dinners. I understand they are open to bus tours and do special things like birthday parties and weddings. All in all it was a wonderful experience and I would HIGHLY recommend this bed and breakfast.
The room we stayed in was slanted. When exiting the bathoom it felt as though you would fall.

reviews.title: Pleased with stay-2 nights
reviews.text: The place gives a eerie feeling, and the owners are never around not even for emergency. We had to use a coat hanger to keep the shower tab down to let the water not back up. The water smelled like eggs. We were not warned that it was well water. There are not amenities for you if you are hungry, and the resturant is not open to house guests during the week. There are are NO stores open around the area.

The floor and structure has serious water and wood rot/damage.The screens in the windows had holes and you could not leave them open. The air conditioner was extremely noisy and did not cool off the extremely small room in 98 degree weather. Not good for people on medication who need to stay cool.
